page.title: 04Communications
page.content: A post lady delivers letters and parcels by bicycle in Pebworth and Broad Marston Mon. to Sat. Long Marston's mail is delivered by post van. A van collects post from the local post office twice a day and takes it to Stratford sorting office. Sunday collections have now ceased. Each village has a red public phone kiosk from which a 3 min. local call costs l0p. Although most homes have a phone there is still a need for this public service. Both villages have a sub-post office annexed to the general store. One can buy postage stamps, T.V. and dog licences, collect weekly child benefit and pensions, pay bills and use National Savings and Giro Bank facilities. The amenities offered by these sub-post offices are important, especially to the elderly.
